error_identification.erroneous_text: Current assessment valid for Q4 2024 - Q1 2025 only. Regime can shift.
error_identification.correct_text: Current assessment valid for Q4 2025 - Q1 2026 only. Regime can shift.
error_identification.impact: Advisory note only - no runtime impact

database_verification.conclusion: ALL database timestamps correctly show 2025-12-09. Error is isolated to CEIO assessment text generation.

root_cause_analysis.description: The error occurred during CEIO narrative generation where the assessment forward-looking window was incorrectly anchored to 2024 instead of 2025.

contributing_factors.explanation: CEIO was processing historical shock data from 2020-2024, creating cognitive anchoring to past dates
LLM training data has stronger representation of 2024 events, creating implicit bias toward that timeframe
Extensive historical analysis may have diluted awareness of current system date
The CEIO assessment generation did not explicitly reference NOW() or current system date

NOT_contributing: System clock error - PostgreSQL NOW() returns 2025-12-09
Agent misconfiguration - All agents logged correct dates

CDMO.attestation: All macro_nodes population occurred on 2025-12-09. No temporal errors in CDMO-generated content.

CRIO.attestation: Shock signatures and edge computations all timestamped 2025-12-09. CRIO-generated specifications reference correct timeframes.

CEIO.attestation: ACKNOWLEDGED ERROR. The anti_overfitting_note in SHOCK_NARRATIVE_MAP_REFINED.json incorrectly states 'Q4 2024 - Q1 2025' when it should state 'Q4 2025 - Q1 2026'. This was a generation-time error, not a data error.

STIG.attestation: Database infrastructure verified correct. All schema timestamps, governance logs, and system clocks show 2025-12-09. Error isolated to text generation, not infrastructure.

unaffected_components: All shock detection logic (historical dates correct)

preventive.action: Inject explicit NOW() reference in all forward-looking assessments
Add temporal validation to governance artifact generation
Include system date header in all CEIO assessments

lessons_learned.finding: LLM temporal reasoning is vulnerable to context anchoring
lessons_learned.implication: Historical analysis tasks create implicit bias toward past timeframes
lessons_learned.recommendation: Always inject explicit current date when generating forward-looking content

governance_disposition.rationale: Error is isolated to advisory text in a non-runtime governance artifact. No data, signals, or execution logic affected.

signatures.attestation: Depth analysis complete. Root cause identified as LLM temporal context confusion during historical analysis. Database integrity verified. Corrective action pending.
